lexUnit.name: annoyance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being annoyed

sentence.text: I tried to show pleasure at their decision and at the same time annoyance that our contract simply would n't permit it .
And found to his annoyance that he was grinding his teeth .
That comes after growing Irish annoyance at the continued failure of the British to ensure that the RUC accompanies the UDR on all its operations .
She spoke quietly in Greek to the boy , soothing his annoyance at the turning off of the video .
Ronni got in , feeling a welcome dart of annoyance at the way he had issued that curt command .
It joined me for the rest of the holiday , much to the annoyance of my fellow passengers .
Busking or playing musical instruments in the Underground , to the annoyance of other passengers , is an offence …
It was after noon by the time we actually got sorted , much to the annoyance of the lady from the Public Relations company who had hired us .
But her annoyance over the pictures could not distract Catherine from her latest -- and biggest -- ambition .
He shows his annoyance with some intimidating facial expression , backed up by a sparse selection of adjectival punctuation invariably using the ` f " word , which he uses with considerable effect .
Serena is torn between her sisterly love and her annoyance with Stella 's aggressive insecurity .
THE Banishing Gripes campaign highlighted the public 's annoyance with British Gas for the inconvenience caused by digging up roads .
To her annoyance a warm blush was steadily creeping into her cheeks .
` I am practical , " Jessamy insisted with some annoyance .
Laura 's normally full , warm lips tightened with annoyance .
Liz suppressed her annoyance before it could take hold .
She stopped as she saw the look of annoyance on his face .
But , despite his annoyance at being seeded No.2 to Baddeley even though he is the present No.1 , he declined to labour the point afterwards .
My annoyance at missing the fish turns to relief when I realise I am not snagged in the roots .
Suppressing her annoyance at being called " Little Sara " , she replied that all was well .
Faint annoyance began to show on Major Tzann 's face .
She turned to Fran , faint annoyance crossing her face .
Robyn leant against the door to the office and found herself experiencing the old , familiar surge of deep annoyance .
To my great annoyance I found myself jealous .

To Erika 's intense annoyance , Fritz promptly accepted the invitation -- obeyed the command , rather -- and as Rosa moved on to the floor with another boy , she was left feeling abandoned -- and foolish .
Who can honestly say that they have never been consumed by that intense annoyance , never felt that burning but wrenching tension and anger at life 's petty frustrations .
This causes considerable annoyance to the Germans , who find themselves being forced to speak English and say that they will settle the matter ` by decree " .
` We are at our wits ; end here " , say the airport management , ` and this has caused considerable upset and annoyance to the lady owning the number published " .
It was , I thought , a measure of her self-control that she had waited until now to express her annoyance .

The Profit Share Scheme was reduced in 1992 but many members have expressed great annoyance that another scheme within the Bank netted two former members of the staff in Britain almost £218,000 between them .

Although this is hardly the headhunter 's fault , the candidate will naturally feel annoyance or even anger that his or her expectations have been raised and then dashed , often without much explanation .
His eyes narrowed , and she felt a flicker of annoyance , this time aimed at herself .
Dotty flushed with annoyance .
Wheeler 's fine face flushed with annoyance and he laughed .
